newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Thai banks seen tapping Australia Kangaroo market.
newsitem.headline: Thai banks seen tapping Australia Kangaroo market.

text.p: Thai borrowers are expected to be the next to issue Australian dollar-denominated Kangaroo bonds, bankers said on Monday.
Kangaroo bonds are issued by foreign borrowers in the Australian domestic market. So far, only Korean institutions have tapped the Kangaroo market.
Thai Farmers Bank and Bangkok Bank are likely candidates for the first Thai issues, the bankers said.
Korea Development Bank launched the first-ever Kangaroo bond last August through lead manager Commonwealth Bank of Australia (CBA).
Bankers Trust later led a bond issue for Korea Exchange Bank and CBA brought a floating rate note issue for Korea Long-Term Credit Bank.
